Node.definition: = an insect with large composite eyes and a single pair of wings; ◄ |iMusca domestica|i*; ► these insects converge in swarms on (rotting) food, dung, and household garbage; ≈ associated with large quantities
= process by which humans or animals stop living
= process by which dead animals cause something else to give off a foul odor; ≈ considered repulsive
= causative process by which something causes liquids to form small bubbles, ◄ due to fermentation

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
literally: precious; hence: = state in which a condition or activity is highly appreciated or considered of high significance
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= behavior which lack good sense
= relatively low frequency of events or short duration of an event
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= the side of the human body which is to the north when facing the direction of the rising sun; in extension: one option as opposed to another

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
literally: road; hence: = action by which humans are travelling from one place to another
= behavior of a person without good sense or wisdom
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
literally: heart; hence: = the ability to think for oneself as opposed to being easily swayed by what others say or do
= state in which humans lack a particular quality that they are supposed to have

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= behavior of a person without good sense or wisdom
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
literally: to come up; hence: = process by which an activity increases in intensity
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether committed on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= state in which an event has a high intensity
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= action by which humans act wrongly, though without the intention to do so
literally: to go out; hence: = process by which an event starts taking place, originating from a certain deity, person, or place
= behavior which lacks good sense
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= causative action by which humans create a hole in the earth by breaking up and moving earth, usually with a digging tool; ► in order to hide something, to set a trap, or to find something that one is searching for
= a hole in the ground; ◄ produced by digging; ► often camouflaged to be used to trap animals; ≈ camouflaged pits were hard to see and people were susceptible to fall into them
= process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control
= causative action by which humans or deities to inflict damage on something

= a continuous vertical structure, usually made of natural stones, that encloses or divides an area of land; ≈ associated with security; in some cases used figuratively to denote integrity, which can be negatively affected by sin
= action by which a person or animal uses teeth to cut into something, like another person or animal

= long legless reptile without eyelids or external ears; it moves by wriggling or gliding; some species have a poisonous bite; ≈ symbol of lurking, unexpected danger; associated with lies, deception, and misleading teaching

Node.gloss: to pull out|to pull up|to uproot|to quarry
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans remove an object from another object into which it had been inserted or attached in a different way
= block of stone, whether fully square or not;◄ found in nature or hewn from a quarry; ► used for building houses, walls, and other constructions
= state of being physically hurt

Node.gloss: to split|to cleave|to rip open|to cut|to rend|to maul|to divide|to break through
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities or human cause an object to split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence
= a single piece of wood taken from a tree, cut and finished, and used for building and construction
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state in which a tool loses its sharp cutting edge, ◄ as a result of frequent use, ► so that it has become ineffective and needs sharpening
= a strong, hard magnetic silvery grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= causative action by which someone causes an object to have a thin cutting edge with the help of an iron implement, ► in order to make it useful and effective as a tool

= state in which a human being, animal, or deity is deemed worthy of respect because of characteristics such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
literally: to make great (one's) strength; hence: = action by which humans summon all their strength in order to be able to perform a certain event
= something that is of benefit to humans; often used in rhetorical questions suggesting that nothing is of benefit at all in a certain situation
= causative process by which a certain condition causes an activity to achieve its intended results
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= action by which a person or animal uses teeth to cut into something, like another person or animal

= long legless reptile without eyelids or external ears; it moves by wriggling or gliding; some species have a poisonous bite; ≈ symbol of lurking, unexpected danger; associated with lies, deception, and misleading teaching
literally: whispering; hence: = action by which humans (appear to) control a snake by means of sounds

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= something that is of benefit to humans; often used in rhetorical questions suggesting that nothing is of benefit at all in a certain situation
literally: master of the tongue; = person skilled in charming snakes
literally: master of the tongue; = person skilled in charming snakes
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= state in which words are uttered with a positive and compassionate attitude

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

= causative action by which deities or humans cause other humans and objects to be removed from existence in a violent way, as if by swallowing up, either by direct intervention or by accomplishing this through the hands of others
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= behavior which lack good sense
= pertaining to being the last part of an event, close to its moment of completion
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= state in which an action is regarded as abnormal and associated with people who are insane
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
= behavior of a person without good sense or wisdom
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X takes place after Y has ceased existing or has been completed

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

Node.gloss: to wear out|to demand work from
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to be engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= exclamation expressing grief and dismay

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= state of being considered fortunate and blessed by God; ≈ accompanied by an attitude of admiration

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= person; ◄ belonging to the social class of the nobility ► and therefore often found in a position of authority; ≈ usually treated with respect
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= process of consuming liquids
= state in which humans are physically inactive or slow

Node.gloss: to sink in|to sag|to cave in
Node.definition: = process by which a flat object bulges downwards through weight, pressure, or lack of strength
exact meaning unsure; probably: = structure consisting of beams and other woodwork forming the roof of a building; ≈ requires proper maintenance
literally: idleness of hands; hence: = state in which humans avoid activity
= state in which an object has a hole or crack in it, so that liquids or other objects can pass through

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

= action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex
= causative action where human or deities cause (other) humans to feel and show great joy

= state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
literally: knowing; hence: = process by which humans are exercising their minds about certain matters
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= actions by which humans or deities consign other humans or deities or inanimate objects to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it
= area enclosed by walls or partitions, floor, and ceiling; ◄ part of building

= actions by which humans or deities consign other humans or deities or inanimate objects to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= causative action or process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to move forward, usually towards a specific destination

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= animal with certain bodily features, such as wings or horns
= part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection
